posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
Read the above documentation as stated, and also, look to moving from the XboxController to the CommandXboxController for your joystick class.

Then look at the WPILib examples that use CommandXboxControllers in CommandBased and you’ll see there is example code that does stuff very closely related to what you’re trying to do.

posts.name: N/A
posts.cooked:
Hi I ran into a similar issue, I was using a Joystick rather than a Xbox controller. I hope  it can solve your problem or at least put you in the right direction.

new JoystickButton(driverJoystick, 2).onTrue(swerveSubsystem.runOnce(swerveSubsystem::zeroHeading));
You will want to make that: new JoystickButton(driverJoystick, 2).onTrue(swerveSubsystem.runOnce(()-> swerveSubsystem::zeroHeading));
